title: A boy bought some mangoes with his savings if he got 20 mangoes more, the price of mangoes would be 25 paise less and if he got 30 mangoes less, the price of mangoes would be 75 paise more. how many mangoes did he buy with how many Rupees? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let x be the original number of mangoes bought. Let the rate per mango be Rs y. According to the problem (x+20)(y- 1/4) = xy …………(1) and (x-30)(y+ 3/4) = xy …………(2) Simplifying the two equations we get x-80y = -20 ……….(3) x-40y = 30………….(4) Solving (3) and (4) we get x = 80 and y = Rs 1.25 Hence the original number of mangoes = 80 and rate per mango = Rs 1.25 ps

He bought 80 mangoes with 100Rupees. Let x be the number of mangoes and y paise,the cost of each apple. Amount spent xy paise. xy=(x+20)(y-25) 25x-20y=-500 5x-4y=-100 xy=(x-30)(y+75) 75x-30y=2250 5x-2y=150 2y=250 y=125 5x=400 x=80 He purchased 80 mangoes at the price of 125 paise =₹1.25 each The money he spent =80*₹1.25=₹100
